the spirits of the dead do not rise.
That is because you came in judgment and destroyed them,
you wiped out all memory of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, in distress they looked for you;
they uttered incantations because of your discipline.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As when a pregnant woman gets ready to deliver
and strains and cries out because of her labor pains,
so were we because of you, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We were pregnant, we strained,
we gave birth, as it were, to wind.
We cannot produce deliverance on the earth;
no people are born to populate the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your dead will come back to life;
your corpses will rise up.
Wake up and shout joyfully, you who live in the ground!
For you will grow like plants drenched with the morning dew,
and the earth will bring forth its dead spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go, my people! Enter your inner rooms!
Close your doors behind you!
Hide for a little while,
until his angry judgment is over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For look, the Lord is coming out of the place where he lives,
to punish the sin of those who live on the earth.
The earth will display the blood shed on it;
it will no longer cover up its slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time the Lord will punish
with his destructive, great, and powerful sword
Leviathan the fast-moving serpent,
Leviathan the squirming serpent;
he will kill the sea monster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When that time comes,
sing about a delightful vineyard!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, the Lord, protect it;
I water it regularly.
I guard it night and day,
so no one can harm it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am not angry.
I wish I could confront some thorns and briers!
Then I would march against them for battle;
I would set them all on fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Has the Lord struck down Israel as he did their oppressors?
Has Israel been killed like their enemies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you summon her for divorce, you prosecute her;
he drives her away with his strong wind in the day of the east wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So in this way Jacob’s sin will be forgiven,
and this is how they will show they are finished sinning:
They will make all the stones of the altars
like crushed limestone,
and the Asherah poles and the incense altars will no longer stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Lord will shake the tree, from the Euphrates River to the Stream of Egypt. Then you will be gathered up one by one, O Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time a large trumpet will be blown, and the ones lost in the land of Assyria will come, as well as the refugees in the land of Egypt. They will worship the Lord on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The splendid crown of Ephraim’s drunkards is doomed,
the withering flower, its beautiful splendor,
situated at the head of a rich valley,
the crown of those overcome with wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, the Lord sends a strong, powerful one.
With the force of a hailstorm or a destructive windstorm,
with the might of a driving, torrential rainstorm,
he will knock that crown to the ground with his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The splendid crown of Ephraim’s drunkards
will be trampled underfoot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The withering flower, its beautiful splendor,
situated at the head of a rich valley,
will be like an early fig before harvest—
as soon as someone notices it,
he grabs it and swallows it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time the Lord of Heaven’s Armies will become a beautiful crown
and a splendid diadem for the remnant of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will give discernment to the one who makes judicial decisions,
and strength to those who defend the city from attackers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even these men stagger because of wine;
they stumble around because of beer—
priests and prophets stagger because of beer,
they are confused because of wine,
they stumble around because of beer;
they stagger while seeing prophetic visions,
they totter while making legal decisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, all the tables
are covered with vomit,
with filth, leaving no clean place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is the Lord trying to teach?
To whom is he explaining a message?
To those just weaned from milk!
To those just taken from their mother’s breast!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, they will hear meaningless gibberish,
senseless babbling,
a syllable here, a syllable there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For with mocking lips and a foreign tongue
he will speak to these people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the past he said to them,
“This is where security can be found.
Provide security for the one who is exhausted.
This is where rest can be found.”
But they refused to listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the Lord’s message to them will sound like
meaningless gibberish,
senseless babbling,
a syllable here, a syllable there.
As a result, they will fall on their backsides when they try to walk,
and be injured, ensnared, and captured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, listen to the Lord’s message,
you who mock,
you rulers of these people
who reside in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you say,
“We have made a treaty with death,
with Sheol we have made an agreement.
When the overwhelming judgment sweeps by
it will not reach us.
For we have made a lie our refuge,
we have hidden ourselves in a deceitful word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Sovereign Lord, says:
“Look, I am laying a stone in Zion,
an approved stone,
set in place as a precious cornerstone for the foundation.
The one who maintains his faith will not panic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make justice the measuring line,
fairness the plumb line;
hail will sweep away the unreliable refuge,
the floodwaters will overwhelm the hiding place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your treaty with death will be dissolved;
your agreement with Sheol will not last.
When the overwhelming judgment sweeps by,
you will be overrun by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whenever it sweeps by, it will overtake you;
indeed, every morning it will sweep by,
it will come through during the day and the night.”
When this announcement is understood,
it will cause nothing but terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the bed is too short to stretch out on,
and the blanket is too narrow to wrap around oneself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will rise up, as he did at Mount Perazim;
he will rouse himself, as he did in the Valley of Gibeon,
to accomplish his work,
his peculiar work,
to perform his task,
his strange task.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So now, do not mock,
or your chains will become heavier!
For I have heard a message about decreed destruction,
from the Sovereign Lord of Heaven’s Armies against the entire land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention and listen to my message.
Be attentive and listen to what I have to say!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does a farmer just keep on plowing at planting time?
Does he keep breaking up and harrowing his ground?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once he has leveled its surface,
does he not scatter the seed of the caraway plant,
sow the seed of the cumin plant,
and plant the wheat, barley, and grain in their designated places?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His God instructs him;
he teaches him the principles of agriculture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Certainly caraway seed is not threshed with a sledge,
nor is the wheel of a cart rolled over cumin seed.
Certainly caraway seed is beaten with a stick,
and cumin seed with a flail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grain is crushed,
though one certainly does not thresh it forever.
The wheel of one’s wagon rolls over it,
but his horses do not crush it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This also comes from the Lord of Heaven’s Armies,
who gives supernatural guidance and imparts great wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ariel is as good as dead—
Ariel, the town David besieged!
Keep observing your annual rituals;
celebrate your festivals on schedule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will threaten Ariel,
and she will mourn intensely
and become like an altar hearth before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But the horde of invaders will be like fine dust,
the horde of tyrants like chaff that is blown away.
It will happen suddenly, in a flash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judgment will come from the Lord of Heaven’s Armies,
accompanied by thunder, earthquake, and a loud noise,
by a strong gale, a windstorm, and a consuming flame of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be like a dream, a night vision.
There will be a horde from all the nations that fight against Ariel,
those who attack her and her stronghold and besiege her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be like a hungry man dreaming that he is eating,
only to awaken and find that his stomach is empty.
It will be like a thirsty man dreaming that he is drinking,
only to awaken and find that he is still weak and his thirst unquenched.
So it will be for the horde from all the nations
that fight against Mount Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be shocked and amazed!
You are totally blind!
They are drunk, but not because of wine;
they stagger, but not because of beer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has poured out on you
a strong urge to sleep deeply.
He has shut your eyes (you prophets),
and covered your heads (you seers).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To you this entire prophetic revelation is like words in a sealed scroll. When they hand it to one who can read and say, “Read this,” he responds, “I can’t, because it is sealed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or when they hand the scroll to one who can’t read and say, “Read this,” he says, “I can’t read.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says,
“These people say they are loyal to me;
they say wonderful things about me,
but they are not really loyal to me.
Their worship consists of
nothing but man-made ritual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will again do an amazing thing for these people—
an absolutely extraordinary deed.
Wise men will have nothing to say,
the sages will have no explanations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who try to hide their plans from the Lord are as good as dead,
who do their work in secret and boast,
“Who sees us? Who knows what we’re doing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your thinking is perverse!
Should the potter be regarded as clay?
Should the thing made say about its maker, “He didn’t make me”?
Or should the pottery say about the potter, “He doesn’t understand”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In just a very short time
Lebanon will turn into an orchard,
and the orchard will be considered a forest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time the deaf will be able to hear words read from a scroll,
and the eyes of the blind will be able to see through deep darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The downtrodden will again rejoice in the Lord;
the poor among humankind will take delight in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For tyrants will disappear,
those who taunt will vanish,
and all those who love to do wrong will be eliminated—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those who bear false testimony against a person,
who entrap the one who arbitrates at the city gate
and deprive the innocent of justice by making false charges.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For when they see their children,
whom I will produce among them,
they will honor my name.
They will honor the Holy One of Jacob;
they will respect the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who stray morally will gain understanding;
those who complain will acquire insight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The rebellious children are as good as dead,” says the Lord,
“those who make plans without consulting me,
who form alliances without consulting my Spirit,
and thereby compound their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They travel down to Egypt
without seeking my will,
seeking Pharaoh’s protection,
and looking for safety in Egypt’s protective shade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Pharaoh’s protection will bring you nothing but shame,
and the safety of Egypt’s protective shade nothing but humiliation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though his officials are in Zoan
and his messengers arrive at Hanes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all will be put to shame
because of a nation that cannot help them,
who cannot give them aid or help,
but only shame and disgrace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is an oracle about the animals in the Negev:
Through a land of distress and danger,
inhabited by lionesses and roaring lions,
by snakes and darting adders,
they transport their wealth on the backs of donkeys,
their riches on the humps of camels,
to a nation that cannot help them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt is totally incapable of helping.
For this reason I call her
“Proud one who is silenced.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now go, write it down on a tablet in their presence,
inscribe it on a scroll,
so that it might be preserved for a future time
as an enduring witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For these are rebellious people—
they are lying children,
children unwilling to obey the Lord’s law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say to the visionaries, “See no more visions!”
and to the seers, “Don’t relate messages to us about what is right!
Tell us nice things;
relate deceptive messages.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For this reason this is what the Holy One of Israel says:
“You have rejected this message;
you trust instead in your ability to oppress and trick,
and rely on that kind of behavior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So this sin will become your downfall.
You will be like a high wall
that bulges and cracks and is ready to collapse;
it crumbles suddenly, in a flash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shatters in pieces like a clay jar,
so shattered to bits that none of it can be salvaged.
Among its fragments one cannot find a shard large enough
to scoop a hot coal from a fire
or to skim off water from a cistern.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You say, ‘No, we will flee on horses,’
so you will indeed flee.
You say, ‘We will ride on fast horses,’
so your pursuers will be fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One thousand will scurry at the battle cry of one enemy soldier;
at the battle cry of five enemy soldiers you will all run away,
until the remaining few are as isolated
as a flagpole on a mountaintop
or a signal flag on a hill.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You will hear a word spoken behind you, saying,
“This is the correct way, walk in it,”
whether you are heading to the right or the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will desecrate your silver-plated idols
and your gold-plated images.
You will throw them away as if they were a menstrual rag,
saying to them, “Get out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will water the seed you plant in the ground,
and the ground will produce crops in abundance.
At that time your cattle will graze in wide pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The oxen and donkeys used in plowing
will eat seasoned feed winnowed with a shovel and pitchfork.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On every high mountain
and every high hill
there will be streams flowing with water,
at the time of great slaughter when the fortified towers collapse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the full moon will be like the sun’s glare,
and the sun’s glare will be seven times brighter,
like the light of seven days,
when the Lord binds up his people’s fractured bones
and heals their severe wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, the name of the Lord comes from a distant place
in raging anger and awesome splendor.
He speaks angrily,
and his word is like destructive fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His battle cry overwhelms like a flooding river
that reaches one’s neck.
He shakes the nations in a sieve that isolates the chaff;
he puts a bit into the mouth of the nations and leads them to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will sing
as you do in the evening when you are celebrating a festival.
You will be happy like one who plays a flute
as he goes to the mountain of the Lord, the Rock who shelters Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will give a mighty shout
and intervene in power,
with furious anger and flaming, destructive fire,
with a driving rainstorm and hailstones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, the Lord’s shout will shatter Assyria;
he will beat them with a club.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every blow from his punishing cudgel
with which the Lord will beat them
will be accompanied by music from the tambourine and harp,
and he will attack them with his weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the burial place is already prepared;
it has been made deep and wide for the king.
The firewood is piled high on it.
The Lord’s breath, like a stream flowing with brimstone,
will ignite it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who go down to Egypt for help are as good as dead;
those who rely on war horses,
and trust in Egypt’s many chariots
and in their many, many horsemen.
But they do not rely on the Holy One of Israel
and do not seek help from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he too is wise and he will bring disaster;
he does not retract his decree.
He will attack the wicked nation,
and the nation that helps those who commit sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, this is what the Lord has said to me:
“The Lord will be like a growling lion,
like a young lion growling over its prey.
Though a whole group of shepherds gathers against it,
it is not afraid of their shouts
or intimidated by their yelling.
In this same way the Lord of Heaven’s Armies will descend
to do battle on Mount Zion and on its hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as birds hover over a nest,
so the Lord of Heaven’s Armies will protect Jerusalem.
He will protect and deliver it;
as he passes over he will rescue it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You Israelites! Return to the one you have so blatantly rebelled against!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For at that time every one will get rid of the silver and gold idols your hands sinfully made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Assyria will fall by a sword, but not one human-made;
a sword not made by humankind will destroy them.
They will run away from this sword
and their young men will be forced to do hard labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will surrender their stronghold because of fear;
their officers will be afraid of the Lord’s battle flag.”
This is what the Lord says—
the one whose fire is in Zion,
whose firepot is in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, a king will promote fairness;
officials will promote justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each of them will be like a shelter from the wind
and a refuge from a rainstorm;
like streams of water in a dry region
and like the shade of a large cliff in a parched land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eyes will no longer be blind
and ears will be attentive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mind that acts rashly will possess discernment,
and the tongue that stutters will speak with ease and clarity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool will no longer be called honorable;
a deceiver will no longer be called principled.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A deceiver’s methods are evil;
he dreams up evil plans
to ruin the poor with lies,
even when the needy are in the right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An honorable man makes honorable plans;
his honorable character gives him security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You complacent women,
get up and listen to me!
You carefree daughters,
pay attention to what I say!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a year’s time
you carefree ones will shake with fear,
for the grape harvest will fail,
and the fruit harvest will not arrive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble, you complacent ones!
Shake with fear, you carefree ones!
Strip off your clothes and expose yourselves—
put sackcloth around your waists.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mourn over the field,
over the delightful fields
and the fruitful vine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mourn over the land of my people,
which is overgrown with thorns and briers,
and over all the once-happy houses
in the city filled with revelry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the fortress is neglected;
the once-crowded city is abandoned.
Hill and watchtower
are permanently uninhabited.
Wild donkeys love to go there,
and flocks graze there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This desolation will continue until new life is poured out on us from heaven.
Then the wilderness will become an orchard
and the orchard will be considered a forest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Justice will settle down in the wilderness
and fairness will live in the orchard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fairness will produce peace
and result in lasting security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people will live in peaceful settlements,
in secure homes,
and in safe, quiet places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even if the forest is destroyed
and the city is annihilated,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you will be blessed,
you who plant seed by all the banks of the streams,
you who let your ox and donkey graze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The destroyer is as good as dead,
you who have not been destroyed!
The deceitful one is as good as dead,
the one whom others have not deceived!
When you are through destroying, you will be destroyed;
when you finish deceiving, others will deceive you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, be merciful to us! We wait for you.
Give us strength each morning.
Deliver us when distress comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations run away when they hear a loud noise;
the nations scatter when you spring into action!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your plunder disappears as if locusts were eating it;
they swarm over it like locusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Look, ambassadors cry out in the streets;
messengers sent to make peace weep bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Highways are empty,
there are no travelers.
Treaties are broken,
witnesses are despised,
human life is treated with disrespect.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The nations will be burned to ashes;
like thorn bushes that have been cut down, they will be set on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who are far away, listen to what I have done!
You who are close by, recognize my strength.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sinners are afraid in Zion;
panic grips the godless.
They say, “Who among us can coexist with destructive fire?
Who among us can coexist with unquenchable fire?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You will see a king in his splendor;
you will see a wide land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your mind will recall the terror you experienced,
and you will ask yourselves, “Where is the scribe?
Where is the one who weighs the money?
Where is the one who counts the towers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will no longer see a defiant people
whose language you do not comprehend,
whose derisive speech you do not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord, our ruler,
the Lord, our commander,
the Lord, our king—
he will deliver us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though at this time your ropes are slack,
the mast is not secured,
and the sail is not unfurled,
at that time you will divide up a great quantity of loot;
even the lame will drag off plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No resident of Zion will say, “I am ill”;
the people who live there will have their sin forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come near, you nations, and listen!
Pay attention, you people!
The earth and everything it contains must listen,
the world and everything that lives in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is angry at all the nations
and furious with all their armies.
He will annihilate them and slaughter them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All the stars in the sky will fade away,
the sky will roll up like a scroll;
all its stars will wither,
like a leaf withers and falls from a vine
or a fig withers and falls from a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He says, “Indeed, my sword has slaughtered heavenly powers.
Look, it now descends on Edom,
on the people I will annihilate in judgment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord’s sword is dripping with blood,
it is covered with fat;
it drips with the blood of young rams and goats
and is covered with the fat of rams’ kidneys.
For the Lord is holding a sacrifice in Bozrah,
a bloody slaughter in the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wild oxen will be slaughtered along with them,
as well as strong bulls.
Their land is drenched with blood,
their soil is covered with fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has planned a day of revenge,
a time when he will repay Edom for her hostility toward Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Night and day it will burn;
its smoke will ascend continually.
Generation after generation it will be a wasteland,
and no one will ever pass through it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Owls and wild animals will live there,
all kinds of wild birds will settle in it.
The Lord will stretch out over her
the measuring line of ruin
and the plumb line of destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her nobles will have nothing left to call a kingdom,
and all her officials will disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Wild animals and wild dogs will congregate there;
wild goats will bleat to one another.
Yes, nocturnal animals will rest there
and make for themselves a nest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Owls will make nests and lay eggs there;
they will hatch them and protect them.
Yes, hawks will gather there,
each with its mate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Carefully read the scroll of the Lord!
Not one of these creatures will be missing,
none will lack a mate.
For the Lord has issued the decree,
and his own spirit gathers them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the wilderness and desert be happy;
let the arid rift valley rejoice and bloom like a lily!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let it richly bloom;
let it rejoice and shout with delight!
It is given the grandeur of Lebanon,
the splendor of Carmel and Sharon.
They will see the grandeur of the Lord,
the splendor of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strengthen the hands that have gone limp,
steady the knees that shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell those who panic,
“Be strong! Do not fear!
Look, your God comes to avenge;
with divine retribution he comes to deliver you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then blind eyes will open,
deaf ears will hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The dry soil will become a pool of water,
the parched ground springs of water.
Where jackals once lived and sprawled out,
grass, reeds, and papyrus will grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A thoroughfare will be there—
it will be called the Way of Holiness.
The unclean will not travel on it;
it is reserved for those authorized to use it—
fools will not stray into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No lions will be there,
no ferocious wild animals will be on it—
they will not be found there.
Those delivered from bondage will travel on it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
those whom the Lord has ransomed will return that way.
They will enter Zion with a happy shout.
Unending joy will crown them,
happiness and joy will overwhelm them;
grief and suffering will disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah’s reign, King Sennacherib of Assyria marched up against all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Assyria sent his chief adviser from Lachish to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem, along with a large army. The chief adviser stood at the conduit of the upper pool that is located on the road to the field where they wash and dry cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace supervisor, accompanied by Shebna the scribe and Joah son of Asaph, the secretary, went out to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief adviser said to them, “Tell Hezekiah: ‘This is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: “What is your source of confidence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your claim to have a strategy and military strength is just empty talk. In whom are you trusting, that you would dare to rebel against me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, you must be trusting in Egypt, that splintered reed staff. If someone leans on it for support, it punctures his hand and wounds him. That is what Pharaoh king of Egypt does to all who trust in him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps you will tell me, ‘We are trusting in the Lord our God.’ But Hezekiah is the one who eliminated his high places and altars and then told the people of Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You must worship at this altar.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now make a deal with my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you 2,000 horses, provided you can find enough riders for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly you will not refuse one of my master’s minor officials and trust in Egypt for chariots and horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore it was by the command of the Lord that I marched up against this land to destroy it. The Lord told me, ‘March up against this land and destroy it!’”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to the chief adviser, “Speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it. Don’t speak with us in the Judahite dialect in the hearing of the people who are on the wall.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief adviser said, “My master did not send me to speak these words only to your master and to you. His message is also for the men who sit on the wall, for they will eat their own excrement and drink their own urine along with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief adviser then stood there and called out loudly in the Judahite dialect, “Listen to the message of the great king, the king of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the king says: ‘Don’t let Hezekiah mislead you, for he is not able to rescue you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t let Hezekiah talk you into trusting in the Lord by saying, “The Lord will certainly rescue us; this city will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t listen to Hezekiah!’ For this is what the king of Assyria says, ‘Send me a token of your submission and surrender to me. Then each of you may eat from his own vine and fig tree and drink water from his own cistern,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I come and take you to a land just like your own—a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah is misleading you when he says, “The Lord will rescue us.” Have any of the gods of the nations rescued their lands from the power of the king of Assyria?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Indeed, did any gods rescue Samaria from my power?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who among all the gods of these lands have rescued their lands from my power? So how can the Lord rescue Jerusalem from my power?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were silent and did not respond, for the king had ordered, “Don’t respond to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace supervisor, accompanied by Shebna the scribe and Joah son of Asaph, the secretary, went to Hezekiah with their clothes torn and reported to him what the chief adviser had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Hezekiah heard this, he tore his clothes, put on sackcloth, and went to the Lord’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliakim the palace supervisor, Shebna the scribe, and the leading priests, clothed in sackcloth, sent this message to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Hezekiah says: ‘This is a day of distress, insults, and humiliation, as when a baby is ready to leave the birth canal, but the mother lacks the strength to push it through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps the Lord your God will hear all these things the chief adviser has spoken on behalf of his master, the king of Assyria, who sent him to taunt the living God. When the Lord your God hears, perhaps he will punish him for the things he has said. So pray for this remnant that remains.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Hezekiah’s servants came to Isaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah said to them, “Tell your master this: ‘This is what the Lord has said: “Don’t be afraid because of the things you have heard—these insults the king of Assyria’s servants have hurled against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I will take control of his mind; he will receive a report and return to his own land. I will cut him down with a sword in his own land.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief adviser heard the king of Assyria had departed from Lachish, he left and went to Libnah, where the king was campaigning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king heard that King Tirhakah of Ethiopia was marching out to fight him. He again sent messengers to Hezekiah, ordering them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell King Hezekiah of Judah this: ‘Don’t let your God in whom you trust mislead you when he says, “Jerusalem will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly you have heard how the kings of Assyria have annihilated all lands. Do you really think you will be rescued?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were the nations whom my predecessors destroyed—the nations of Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the people of Eden in Telassar—rescued by their gods?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is the king of Hamath or the king of Arpad or the kings of Lair, Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah took the letter from the messengers and read it. Then Hezekiah went up to the Lord’s temple and spread it out before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah prayed before the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Lord of Heaven’s Armies, O God of Israel, who is enthroned on the cherubim! You alone are God over all the kingdoms of the earth. You made the sky and the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pay attention, Lord, and hear! Open your eyes, Lord, and observe! Listen to this entire message Sennacherib sent and how he taunts the living God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is true, Lord, that the kings of Assyria have destroyed all the nations and their lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have burned the gods of the nations, for they are not really gods, but only the product of human hands manufactured from wood and stone. That is why the Assyrians could destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, O Lord our God, rescue us from his power, so all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you alone are the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah son of Amoz sent this message to Hezekiah: “This is what the Lord God of Israel has said: ‘As to what you have prayed to me concerning King Sennacherib of Assyria,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
this is what the Lord says about him:
“‘The virgin daughter Zion
despises you—she makes fun of you;
daughter Jerusalem
shakes her head after you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom have you taunted and hurled insults at?
At whom have you shouted
and looked so arrogantly?
At the Holy One of Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through your messengers you taunted the Lord,
“With my many chariots I climbed up
the high mountains,
the slopes of Lebanon.
I cut down its tall cedars
and its best evergreens.
I invaded its remotest regions,
its thickest woods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I dug wells
and drank water.
With the soles of my feet I dried up
all the rivers of Egypt.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Certainly you must have heard!
Long ago I worked it out,
in ancient times I planned it,
and now I am bringing it to pass.
The plan is this:
Fortified cities will crash
into heaps of ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their residents are powerless;
they are terrified and ashamed.
They are as short-lived as plants in the field
or green vegetation.
They are as short-lived as grass on the rooftops
when it is scorched by the east wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know where you live
and everything you do
and how you rage against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you rage against me
and the uproar you create has reached my ears,
I will put my hook in your nose,
and my bit between your lips,
and I will lead you back
the way you came.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This will be your reminder that I have spoken the truth: This year you will eat what grows wild, and next year what grows on its own. But the year after that you will plant seed and harvest crops; you will plant vines and consume their produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who remain in Judah will take root in the ground and bear fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So this is what the Lord says about the king of Assyria:
“‘He will not enter this city,
nor will he shoot an arrow here.
He will not attack it with his shielded warriors,
nor will he build siege works against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will go back the way he came—
he will not enter this city,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will shield this city and rescue it
for the sake of my reputation and because of my promise to David my servant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord went out and killed 185,000 troops in the Assyrian camp. When they got up early the next morning, there were all the corpses!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Sennacherib of Assyria broke camp and went on his way. He went home and stayed in Nineveh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, as he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer struck him down with the sword. They ran away to the land of Ararat; his son Esarhaddon replaced him as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Hezekiah was stricken with a terminal illness. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz visited him and told him, “This is what the Lord says, ‘Give instructions to your household, for you are about to die; you will not get well.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Please, Lord. Remember how I have served you faithfully and with wholehearted devotion, and how I have carried out your will.” Then Hezekiah wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord’s message came to Isaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and tell Hezekiah: ‘This is what the Lord God of your ancestor David says: “I have heard your prayer; I have seen your tears. Look, I will add fifteen years to your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also rescue you and this city from the king of Assyria. I will shield this city.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah replied, “This is your sign from the Lord confirming that the Lord will do what he has said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I will make the shadow go back ten steps on the stairs of Ahaz.” And then the shadow went back ten steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the prayer of King Hezekiah of Judah when he was sick and then recovered from his illness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I thought,
‘In the middle of my life I must walk through the gates of Sheol,
I am deprived of the rest of my years.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I thought,
‘I will no longer see the Lord in the land of the living,
I will no longer look on humankind with the inhabitants of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My dwelling place is removed and taken away from me
as a shepherd’s tent.
I rolled up my life like a weaver rolls cloth;
from the loom he cuts me off.
You turn day into night and end my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
What can I say?
He has decreed and acted.
I will walk slowly all my years because I am overcome with grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Look, the grief I experienced was for my benefit.
You delivered me from the Pit of oblivion.
For you removed all my sins from your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The living person, the living person, he gives you thanks,
as I do today.
A father tells his sons about your faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is about to deliver me,
and we will celebrate with music
for the rest of our lives in the Lord’s temple.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Isaiah ordered, “Let them take a fig cake and apply it to the ulcerated sore and he will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah said, “What is the confirming sign that I will go up to the Lord’s temple?”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Merodach Baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah, for he heard that Hezekiah had been ill and had recovered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah welcomed them and showed them his storehouse with its silver, gold, spices, and high-quality olive oil, as well as his whole armory and everything in his treasuries. Hezekiah showed them everything in his palace and in his whole kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah the prophet visited King Hezekiah and asked him, “What did these men say? Where do they come from?” Hezekiah replied, “They come from the distant land of Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah asked, “What have they seen in your palace?” Hezekiah replied, “They have seen everything in my palace. I showed them everything in my treasuries.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Listen to the message of the Lord of Heaven’s Armies:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Look, a time is coming when everything in your palace and the things your ancestors have accumulated to this day will be carried away to Babylon; nothing will be left,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Some of your very own descendants whom you father will be taken away and will be made eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The Lord’s message that you have announced is appropriate.” Then he thought, “For there will be peace and stability during my lifetime.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Comfort, comfort my people,”
says your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Speak kindly to Jerusalem and tell her
that her time of warfare is over,
that her punishment is completed.
For the Lord has made her pay double for all her sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Every valley must be elevated,
and every mountain and hill leveled.
The rough terrain will become a level plain,
the rugged landscape a wide valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The splendor of the Lord will be revealed,
and all people will see it at the same time.
For the Lord has decreed it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice says, “Cry out!”
Another asks, “What should I cry out?”
The first voice responds: “All people are like grass,
and all their promises are like the flowers in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The grass dries up,
the flowers wither,
when the wind sent by the Lord blows on them.
Surely humanity is like grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The grass dries up,
the flowers wither,
but the decree of our God is forever reliable.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go up on a high mountain, O herald Zion.
Shout out loudly, O herald Jerusalem!
Shout, don’t be afraid!
Say to the towns of Judah,
“Here is your God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who has measured out the waters in the hollow of his hand,
or carefully measured the sky,
or carefully weighed the soil of the earth,
or weighed the mountains in a balance,
or the hills on scales?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who comprehends the mind of the Lord,
or gives him instruction as his counselor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From whom does he receive directions?
Who teaches him the correct way to do things,
or imparts knowledge to him,
or instructs him in skillful design?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Not even Lebanon could supply enough firewood for a sacrifice;
its wild animals would not provide enough burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the nations are insignificant before him;
they are regarded as absolutely nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom can you compare God?
To what image can you liken him?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do you not know?
Do you not hear?
Has it not been told to you since the very beginning?
Have you not understood from the time the earth’s foundations were made?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the one who sits on the earth’s horizon;
its inhabitants are like grasshoppers before him.
He is the one who stretches out the sky like a thin curtain,
and spreads it out like a pitched tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the one who reduces rulers to nothing;
he makes the earth’s leaders insignificant.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“To whom can you compare me? Whom do I resemble?”
says the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look up at the sky!
Who created all these heavenly lights?
He is the one who leads out their ranks;
he calls them all by name.
Because of his absolute power and awesome strength,
not one of them is missing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you say, Jacob,
Why do you say, Israel,
“The Lord is not aware of what is happening to me;
My God is not concerned with my vindication”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you not know?
Have you not heard?
The Lord is an eternal God,
the Creator of the whole earth.
He does not get tired or weary;
there is no limit to his wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gives strength to those who are tired;
to the ones who lack power, he gives renewed energy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even youths get tired and weary;
even strong young men clumsily stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who wait for the Lord’s help find renewed strength;
they rise up as if they had eagles’ wings,
they run without growing weary,
they walk without getting tired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to me in silence, you coastlands!
Let the nations find renewed strength!
Let them approach and then speak;
let us come together for debate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who stirs up this one from the east?
Who officially commissions him for service?
He hands nations over to him,
and enables him to subdue kings.
He makes them like dust with his sword,
like windblown straw with his bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He pursues them and passes by unharmed;
he advances with great speed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who acts and carries out decrees?
Who summons the successive generations from the beginning?
I, the Lord, am present at the very beginning,
and at the very end—I am the one.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They help one another;
one says to the other, ‘Be strong!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The craftsman encourages the metalsmith,
the one who wields the hammer encourages the one who pounds on the anvil.
He approves the quality of the welding,
and nails it down so it won’t fall over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You, my servant Israel,
Jacob, whom I have chosen,
offspring of Abraham my friend,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you whom I am bringing back from the earth’s extremities,
and have summoned from the remote regions—
I told you, ‘You are my servant.’
I have chosen you and not rejected you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t be afraid, for I am with you!
Don’t be frightened, for I am your God!
I strengthen you—
yes, I help you—
yes, I uphold you with my victorious right hand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, all who were angry at you will be ashamed and humiliated;
your adversaries will be reduced to nothing and perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you will look for your opponents, you will not find them;
your enemies will be reduced to absolutely nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am the Lord your God,
the one who takes hold of your right hand,
who says to you, ‘Don’t be afraid, I am helping you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t be afraid, despised insignificant Jacob,
men of Israel.
I am helping you,” says the Lord,
your Protector, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look, I am making you like a sharp threshing sledge,
new and double-edged.
You will thresh the mountains and crush them;
you will make the hills like straw.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will make streams flow down the slopes
and produce springs in the middle of the valleys.
I will turn the wilderness into a pool of water
and the arid land into springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make cedars, acacias, myrtles, and olive trees grow in the wilderness;
I will make evergreens, firs, and cypresses grow together in the arid rift valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will do this so people will observe and recognize,
so they will pay attention and understand
that the Lord’s power has accomplished this,
and that the Holy One of Israel has brought it into being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Present your argument,” says the Lord.
“Produce your evidence,” says Jacob’s king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let them produce evidence! Let them tell us what will happen!
Tell us about your earlier predictive oracles,
so we may examine them and see how they were fulfilled.
Or decree for us some future events!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Predict how future events will turn out,
so we might know you are gods.
Yes, do something good or something bad,
so we might be frightened and in awe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, you are nothing, and your accomplishments are nonexistent;
the one who chooses to worship you is disgusting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have stirred up one out of the north and he advances,
one from the eastern horizon who prays in my name.
He steps on rulers as if they were clay,
like a potter treading the clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who decreed this from the beginning, so we could know?
Who announced it ahead of time, so we could say, ‘He’s correct’?
Indeed, none of them decreed it.
Indeed, none of them announced it.
Indeed, no one heard you say anything!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I first decreed to Zion, ‘Look, here’s what will happen!’
I sent a herald to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I look, but there is no one,
among them there is no one who serves as an adviser,
that I might ask questions and receive answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Here is my servant whom I support,
my chosen one in whom I take pleasure.
I have placed my Spirit on him;
he will make just decrees for the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not cry out or shout;
he will not publicize himself in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the true God, the Lord, says—
the one who created the sky and stretched it out,
the one who fashioned the earth and everything that lives on it,
the one who gives breath to the people on it,
and life to those who live on it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, the Lord, officially commission you;
I take hold of your hand.
I protect you and make you a covenant mediator for people,
and a light to the nations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to open blind eyes,
to release prisoners from dungeons,
those who live in darkness from prisons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I am the Lord! That is my name!
I will not share my glory with anyone else,
or the praise due me with idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, my earlier predictive oracles have come to pass;
now I announce new events.
Before they begin to occur,
I reveal them to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord a brand new song!
Praise him from the horizon of the earth,
you who go down to the sea, and everything that lives in it,
you coastlands and those who live there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the wilderness and its cities shout out,
the towns where the nomads of Kedar live.
Let the residents of Sela shout joyfully;
let them shout loudly from the mountaintops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give the Lord the honor he deserves;
let them praise his deeds in the coastlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord emerges like a hero,
like a warrior he inspires himself for battle;
he shouts, yes, he yells,
he shows his enemies his power.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will make the trees on the mountains and hills wither up;
I will dry up all their vegetation.
I will turn streams into islands,
and dry up pools of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lead the blind along an unfamiliar way;
I will guide them down paths they have never traveled.
I will turn the darkness in front of them into light,
and level out the rough ground.
This is what I will do for them.
I will not abandon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who trust in idols
will turn back and be utterly humiliated,
those who say to metal images, ‘You are our gods.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen, you deaf ones!
Take notice, you blind ones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My servant is truly blind,
my messenger is truly deaf.
My covenant partner, the servant of the Lord, is truly blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You see many things, but don’t comprehend;
their ears are open, but do not hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord wanted to exhibit his justice
by magnifying his law and displaying it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who among you will pay attention to this?
Who will listen attentively in the future?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who handed Jacob over to the robber?
Who handed Israel over to the looters?
Was it not the Lord, against whom we sinned?
They refused to follow his commands;
they disobeyed his law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he poured out his fierce anger on them,
along with the devastation of war.
Its flames encircled them, but they did not realize it;
it burned against them, but they did not take it to heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, this is what the Lord says,
the one who created you, O Jacob,
and formed you, O Israel:
“Don’t be afraid, for I will protect you.
I call you by name, you are mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I am the Lord your God,
the Holy One of Israel, your deliverer.
I have handed over Egypt as a ransom price,
Ethiopia and Seba in place of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since you are precious and special in my sight,
and I love you,
I will hand over people in place of you,
nations in place of your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will say to the north, ‘Hand them over!’
and to the south, ‘Don’t hold any back!’
Bring my sons from distant lands,
and my daughters from the remote regions of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
everyone who belongs to me,
whom I created for my glory,
whom I formed—yes, whom I made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bring out the people who are blind, even though they have eyes,
those who are deaf, even though they have ears!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All nations gather together,
the peoples assemble.
Who among them announced this?
Who predicted earlier events for us?
Let them produce their witnesses to testify they were right;
let them listen and affirm, “It is true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are my witnesses,” says the Lord,
“my servant whom I have chosen,
so that you may consider and believe in me,
and understand that I am he.
No god was formed before me,
and none will outlive me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I, I am the Lord,
and there is no deliverer besides me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I decreed and delivered and proclaimed,
and there was no other god among you.
You are my witnesses,” says the Lord, “that I am God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says,
your Protector, the Holy One of Israel:
“For your sake I send to Babylon
and make them all fugitives,
turning the Babylonians’ joyful shouts into mourning songs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord, your Holy One,
the one who created Israel, your king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says,
the one who made a road through the sea,
a pathway through the surging waters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the one who led chariots and horses to destruction,
together with a mighty army.
They fell down, never to rise again;
they were extinguished, put out like a burning wick:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Don’t remember these earlier events;
don’t recall these former events.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I am about to do something new.
Now it begins to happen! Do you not recognize it?
Yes, I will make a road in the wilderness
and paths in the wastelands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wild animals honor me,
the jackals and ostriches,
because I put water in the wilderness
and streams in the wastelands,
to quench the thirst of my chosen people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the people whom I formed for myself,
so they might praise me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But you did not call for me, O Jacob;
you did not long for me, O Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I, I am the one who blots out your rebellious deeds for my sake;
your sins I do not remember.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remind me of what happened. Let’s debate!
You, prove to me that you are right!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The father of your nation sinned;
your spokesmen rebelled against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I defiled your holy princes,
and handed Jacob over to destruction,
and subjected Israel to humiliating abuse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now, listen, Jacob my servant,
Israel whom I have chosen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord, the one who made you, says—
the one who formed you in the womb and helps you:
“Don’t be afraid, my servant Jacob,
Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will pour water on the parched ground
and cause streams to flow on the dry land.
I will pour my Spirit on your offspring
and my blessing on your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will sprout up like a tree in the grass,
like poplars beside channels of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One will say, ‘I belong to the Lord,’
and another will use the name ‘Jacob.’
One will write on his hand, ‘The Lord’s,’
and use the name ‘Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord, Israel’s king, says,
their Protector, the Lord of Heaven’s Armies:
“I am the first and I am the last,
there is no God but me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is like me? Let him make his claim!
Let him announce it and explain it to me—
since I established an ancient people—
let them announce future events.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t panic! Don’t be afraid!
Did I not tell you beforehand and decree it?
You are my witnesses! Is there any God but me?
There is no other sheltering rock; I know of none.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who forms a god and casts an idol
that will prove worthless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, all his associates will be put to shame;
the craftsmen are mere humans.
Let them all assemble and take their stand.
They will panic and be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A carpenter takes measurements;
he marks out an outline of its form;
he scrapes it with chisels,
and marks it with a compass.
He patterns it after the human form,
like a well-built human being,
and puts it in a shrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cuts down cedars
and acquires a cypress or an oak.
He gets trees from the forest;
he plants a cedar and the rain makes it grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Half of it he burns in the fire—
over that half he cooks meat;
he roasts a meal and fills himself.
Yes, he warms himself and says,
‘Ah! I am warm as I look at the fire.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With the rest of it he makes a god, his idol;
he bows down to it and worships it.
He prays to it, saying,
‘Rescue me, for you are my god!’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
No one thinks to himself,
nor do they comprehend or understand and say to themselves:
‘I burned half of it in the fire—
yes, I baked bread over the coals;
I roasted meat and ate it.
With the rest of it should I make a disgusting idol?
Should I bow down to dry wood?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He feeds on ashes;
his deceived mind misleads him.
He cannot rescue himself,
nor does he say, ‘Is this not a false god I hold in my right hand?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember these things, O Jacob,
O Israel, for you are my servant.
I formed you to be my servant;
O Israel, I will not forget you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I remove the guilt of your rebellious deeds as if they were a cloud,
the guilt of your sins as if they were a cloud.
Come back to me, for I protect you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord, your Protector, says,
the one who formed you in the womb:
“I am the Lord, who made everything,
who alone stretched out the sky,
who fashioned the earth all by myself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who frustrates the omens of the empty talkers
and humiliates the omen readers,
who overturns the counsel of the wise men
and makes their advice seem foolish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who fulfills the oracles of his prophetic servants
and brings to pass the announcements of his messengers,
who says about Jerusalem, ‘She will be inhabited,’
and about the towns of Judah, ‘They will be rebuilt,
her ruins I will raise up,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who says to the deep sea, ‘Be dry!
I will dry up your sea currents,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who commissions Cyrus, the one I appointed as shepherd
to carry out all my wishes
and to decree concerning Jerusalem, ‘She will be rebuilt,’
and concerning the temple, ‘It will be reconstructed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is what the Lord says to his chosen one,
to Cyrus, whose right hand I hold
in order to subdue nations before him,
and disarm kings,
to open doors before him,
so gates remain unclosed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will go before you
and level mountains.
Bronze doors I will shatter
and iron bars I will hack through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give you hidden treasures,
riches stashed away in secret places,
so you may recognize that I am the Lord,
the one who calls you by name, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of my servant Jacob,
Israel, my chosen one,
I call you by name
and give you a title of respect, even though you do not submit to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord, I have no peer,
there is no God but me.
I arm you for battle, even though you do not recognize me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I am the one who forms light
and creates darkness;
the one who brings about peace
and creates calamity.
I am the Lord, who accomplishes all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O sky, rain down from above!
Let the clouds send down showers of deliverance!
Let the earth absorb it so salvation may grow,
and deliverance may sprout up along with it.
I, the Lord, create it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who argues with his Creator is in grave danger,
one who is like a mere shard among the other shards on the ground!
The clay should not say to the potter,
“What in the world are you doing?
Your work lacks skill!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Danger awaits one who says to his father,
“What in the world are you fathering?”
and to his mother,
“What in the world are you bringing forth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says,
the Holy One of Israel, the one who formed him,
concerning things to come:
“How dare you question me about my children!
How dare you tell me what to do with the work of my own hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made the earth;
I created the people who live on it.
It was me—my hands stretched out the sky.
I give orders to all the heavenly lights.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“The profit of Egypt and the revenue of Ethiopia,
along with the Sabeans, those tall men,
will be brought to you and become yours.
They will walk behind you, coming along in chains.
They will bow down to you
and pray to you:
‘Truly God is with you; he has no peer;
there is no other God!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, you are a God who keeps hidden,
O God of Israel, deliverer!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will all be ashamed and embarrassed;
those who fashion idols will all be humiliated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel will be delivered once and for all by the Lord;
you will never again be ashamed or humiliated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says,
the one who created the sky—
he is the true God,
the one who formed the earth and made it;
he established it,
he did not create it without order,
he formed it to be inhabited:
“I am the Lord, I have no peer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not spoken in secret,
in some hidden place.
I did not tell Jacob’s descendants,
‘Seek me in vain!’
I am the Lord,
the one who speaks honestly,
who makes reliable announcements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather together and come!
Approach together, you refugees from the nations.
Those who carry wooden idols know nothing,
those who pray to a god that cannot deliver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell me! Present the evidence!
Let them consult with one another.
Who predicted this in the past?
Who announced it beforehand?
Was it not I, the Lord?
I have no peer, there is no God but me,
a God who vindicates and delivers;
there is none but me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me so you can be delivered,
all you who live in the earth’s remote regions!
For I am God, and I have no peer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I solemnly make this oath—
what I say is true and reliable:
‘Surely every knee will bow to me,
every tongue will solemnly affirm;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they will say about me,
“Yes, the Lord is a powerful deliverer.”’”
All who are angry at him will cower before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the descendants of Israel will be vindicated by the Lord
and will boast in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bel kneels down,
Nebo bends low.
Their images weigh down animals and beasts.
Your heavy images are burdensome to tired animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to me, O family of Jacob,
all you who are left from the family of Israel,
you who have been carried from birth,
you who have been supported from the time you left the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even when you are old, I will take care of you,
even when you have gray hair, I will carry you.
I made you and I will support you;
I will carry you and rescue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom can you compare and liken me?
Tell me whom you think I resemble, so we can be compared!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who empty out gold from a purse
and weigh out silver on the scale
hire a metalsmith, who makes it into a god.
They then bow down and worship it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Remember this, so you can be brave.
Think about it, you rebels!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
who announces the end from the beginning
and reveals beforehand what has not yet occurred;
who says, ‘My plan will be realized,
I will accomplish what I desire;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who summons an eagle from the east,
from a distant land, one who carries out my plan.
Yes, I have decreed,
yes, I will bring it to pass;
I have formulated a plan,
yes, I will carry it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, you stubborn people,
you who distance yourselves from doing what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Fall down! Sit in the dirt,
O virgin daughter Babylon!
Sit on the ground, not on a throne,
O daughter of the Babylonians!
Indeed, you will no longer be called delicate and pampered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pick up millstones and grind flour.
Remove your veil,
strip off your skirt,
expose your legs,
cross the streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your naked body be exposed.
Your shame will be on display!
I will get revenge;
I will not have pity on anyone,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
says our Protector—
the Lord of Heaven’s Armies is his name,
the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Sit silently! Go to a hiding place,
O daughter of the Babylonians!
Indeed, you will no longer be called ‘Queen of kingdoms.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You said,
‘I will rule forever as permanent queen!’
You did not think about these things;
you did not consider how it would turn out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So now, listen to this,
O one who lives so lavishly,
who lives securely,
who says to herself,
‘I am unique! No one can compare to me!
I will never have to live as a widow;
I will never lose my children.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Both of these will come upon you
suddenly, in one day!
You will lose your children and be widowed.
You will be overwhelmed by these tragedies,
despite your many incantations
and your numerous amulets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were complacent in your evil deeds;
you thought, ‘No one sees me.’
Your self-professed wisdom and knowledge lead you astray,
when you say, ‘I am unique! No one can compare to me!’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Persist in trusting your amulets
and your many incantations,
which you have faithfully recited since your youth!
Maybe you will be successful—
maybe you will scare away disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are tired out from listening to so much advice.
Let them take their stand—
the ones who see omens in the sky,
who gaze at the stars,
who make monthly predictions—
let them rescue you from the disaster that is about to overtake you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, they are like straw,
that the fire burns up;
they cannot rescue themselves
from the heat of the flames.
There are no coals to warm them,
no firelight to enjoy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will disappoint you,
those you have so faithfully dealt with since your youth.
Each strays off in his own direction,
leaving no one to rescue you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to this, O family of Jacob,
you who are called by the name ‘Israel,’
and are descended from Judah,
who take oaths in the name of the Lord,
and invoke the God of Israel—
but not in an honest and just manner.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I did this because I know how stubborn you are.
Your neck muscles are like iron
and your forehead like bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I announced them to you beforehand;
before they happened, I predicted them for you,
so you could never say,
‘My image did these things,
my idol, my cast image, decreed them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have heard; now look at all the evidence!
Will you not admit that what I say is true?
From this point on I am announcing to you new events
that are previously unrevealed and you do not know about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now they come into being, not in the past;
before today you did not hear about them,
so you could not say,
‘Yes, I know about them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You did not hear,
you do not know,
you were not told beforehand.
For I know that you are very deceitful;
you were labeled a rebel from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of my reputation I hold back my anger;
for the sake of my prestige I restrain myself from destroying you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I have refined you, but not as silver;
I have purified you in the furnace of misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my sake alone I will act,
for how can I allow my name to be defiled?
I will not share my glory with anyone else!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, O Jacob,
Israel, whom I summoned.
I am the one;
I am present at the very beginning
and at the very end.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All of you, gather together and listen!
Who among them announced these things?
The Lord’s ally will carry out his desire against Babylon;
he will exert his power against the Babylonians.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Approach me—listen to this!
From the very first I have not spoken in secret;
when it happens, I am there.”
So now, the Sovereign Lord has sent me, accompanied by his Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord, your Protector, says,
the Holy One of Israel:
“I am the Lord your God,
who teaches you how to succeed,
who leads you in the way you should go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only you had obeyed my commandments,
prosperity would have flowed to you like a river,
deliverance would have come to you like the waves of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your descendants would have been as numerous as sand,
and your children like its granules.
Their name would not have been cut off
and eliminated from my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave Babylon!
Flee from the Babylonians!
Announce it with a shout of joy!
Make this known—
proclaim it throughout the earth!
Say, ‘The Lord protects his servant Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: There will be no prosperity for the wicked,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, you coastlands!
Pay attention, you people who live far away!
The Lord summoned me from birth;
he commissioned me when my mother brought me into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made my mouth like a sharp sword,
he hid me in the hollow of his hand;
he made me like a sharpened arrow,
he hid me in his quiver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to me, “You are my servant,
Israel, through whom I will reveal my splendor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So now the Lord says,
the one who formed me from birth to be his servant—
he did this to restore Jacob to himself,
so that Israel might be gathered to him;
and I will be honored in the Lord’s sight,
for my God is my source of strength—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he says, “Is it too insignificant a task for you to be my servant,
to reestablish the tribes of Jacob,
and restore the remnant of Israel?
I will make you a light to the nations,
so you can bring my deliverance to the remote regions of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord,
the Protector of Israel, their Holy One, says
to the one who is despised and rejected by nations,
a servant of rulers:
“Kings will see and rise in respect,
princes will bow down,
because of the faithful Lord,
the Holy One of Israel who has chosen you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You will say to the prisoners, ‘Come out,’
and to those who are in dark dungeons, ‘Emerge.’
They will graze beside the roads;
on all the slopes they will find pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will make all my mountains into a road;
I will construct my roadways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, they come from far away!
Look, some come from the north and west,
and others from the land of Sinim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shout for joy, O sky!
Rejoice, O earth!
Let the mountains give a joyful shout!
For the Lord consoles his people
and shows compassion to the oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Zion said, ‘The Lord has abandoned me,
the Lord has forgotten me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
