Can a woman forget her baby who nurses at her breast?
Can she withhold compassion from the child she has borne?
Even if mothers were to forget,
I could never forget you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I have inscribed your name on my palms;
your walls are constantly before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your children hurry back,
while those who destroyed and devastated you depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look all around you!
All of them gather to you.
As surely as I live,” says the Lord,
“you will certainly wear all of them like jewelry;
you will put them on as if you were a bride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, your land lies in ruins;
it is desolate and devastated.
But now you will be too small to hold your residents,
and those who devoured you will be far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet the children born during your time of bereavement
will say within your hearing,
‘This place is too cramped for us,
make room for us so we can live here.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will think to yourself,
‘Who bore these children for me?
I was bereaved and barren,
dismissed and divorced.
Who raised these children?
Look, I was left all alone;
where did these children come from?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Sovereign Lord says:
“Look I will raise my hand to the nations;
I will raise my signal flag to the peoples.
They will bring your sons in their arms
and carry your daughters on their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Can spoils be taken from a warrior,
or captives be rescued from a conqueror?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed,” says the Lord,
“captives will be taken from a warrior;
spoils will be rescued from a conqueror.
I will oppose your adversary
and I will rescue your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make your oppressors eat their own flesh;
they will get drunk on their own blood, as if it were wine.
Then all humankind will recognize that
I am the Lord, your Deliverer,
your Protector, the Powerful One of Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Where is your mother’s divorce certificate
by which I divorced her?
Or to which of my creditors did I sell you?
Look, you were sold because of your sins;
because of your rebellious acts I divorced your mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why does no one challenge me when I come?
Why does no one respond when I call?
Is my hand too weak to deliver you?
Do I lack the power to rescue you?
Look, with a mere shout I can dry up the sea;
I can turn streams into a desert,
so the fish rot away and die
from lack of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I can clothe the sky in darkness;
I can cover it with sackcloth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Sovereign Lord has given me the capacity to be his spokesman,
so that I know how to help the weary.
He wakes me up every morning;
he makes me alert so I can listen attentively as disciples do.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I offered my back to those who attacked,
my jaws to those who tore out my beard;
I did not hide my face
from insults and spitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Sovereign Lord helps me,
so I am not humiliated.
For that reason I am steadfastly resolved;
I know I will not be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who vindicates me is close by.
Who dares to argue with me? Let us confront each other!
Who is my accuser? Let him challenge me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, the Sovereign Lord helps me.
Who dares to condemn me?
Look, all of them will wear out like clothes;
a moth will eat away at them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who among you fears the Lord?
Who obeys his servant?
Whoever walks in deep darkness,
without light,
should trust in the name of the Lord
and rely on his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, all of you who start a fire
and who equip yourselves with flaming arrows,
walk in the light of the fire you started
and among the flaming arrows you ignited!
This is what you will receive from me:
you will lie down in a place of pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Listen to me, you who pursue godliness,
who seek the Lord.
Look at the rock from which you were chiseled,
at the quarry from which you were dug.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look at Abraham, your father,
and Sarah, who gave you birth.
When I summoned him, he was a lone individual,
but I blessed him and gave him numerous descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Certainly the Lord will console Zion;
he will console all her ruins.
He will make her wilderness like Eden,
her arid rift valley like the garden of the Lord.
Happiness and joy will be restored to her,
thanksgiving and the sound of music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention to me, my people.
Listen to me, my people!
For I will issue a decree,
I will make my justice a light to the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am ready to vindicate,
I am ready to deliver,
I will establish justice among the nations.
The coastlands wait patiently for me;
they wait in anticipation for the revelation of my power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look up at the sky.
Look at the earth below.
For the sky will dissipate like smoke,
and the earth will wear out like clothes;
its residents will die like gnats.
But the deliverance I give is permanent;
the vindication I provide will not disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, you who know what is right,
you people who are aware of my law.
Don’t be afraid of the insults of men;
don’t be discouraged because of their abuse.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Wake up! Wake up!
Clothe yourself with strength, O arm of the Lord!
Wake up as in former times, as in antiquity.
Did you not smash the Proud One?
Did you not wound the sea monster?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did you not dry up the sea,
the waters of the great deep?
Did you not make a path through the depths of the sea,
so those delivered from bondage could cross over?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I, I am the one who consoles you.
Why are you afraid of mortal men,
of mere human beings who are as short-lived as grass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you forget the Lord, who made you,
who stretched out the sky
and founded the earth?
Why do you constantly tremble all day long
at the anger of the oppressor,
when he makes plans to destroy?
Where is the anger of the oppressor?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord your God,
who churns up the sea so that its waves surge.
The Lord of Heaven’s Armies is his name!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I commission you as my spokesman;
I cover you with the palm of my hand,
to establish the sky and to found the earth,
to say to Zion, ‘You are my people.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wake up! Wake up!
Get up, O Jerusalem!
You drank from the cup the Lord passed to you,
which was full of his anger.
You drained dry
the goblet full of intoxicating wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There was no one to lead her
among all the children she bore;
there was no one to take her by the hand
among all the children she raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These double disasters confronted you.
But who feels sorry for you?
Destruction and devastation,
famine and sword.
But who consoles you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your children faint;
they lie at the head of every street
like an antelope in a snare.
They are left in a stupor by the Lord’s anger,
by the battle cry of your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So listen to this, oppressed one,
who is drunk, but not from wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what your Sovereign Lord, even your God who judges his people says:
“Look, I have removed from your hand
the cup of intoxicating wine,
the goblet full of my anger.
You will no longer have to drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will put it into the hand of your tormentors
who said to you, ‘Lie down, so we can walk over you.’
You made your back like the ground,
and like the street for those who walked over you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wake up! Wake up!
Clothe yourself with strength, O Zion!
Put on your beautiful clothes,
O Jerusalem, holy city.
For uncircumcised and unclean pagans
will no longer invade you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shake off the dirt!
Get up, captive Jerusalem.
Take off the iron chains around your neck,
O captive daughter Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says:
“You were sold for nothing,
and you will not be redeemed for money.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And now, what do we have here?” says the Lord.
“Indeed my people have been carried away for nothing,
those who rule over them taunt,” says the Lord,
“and my name is constantly slandered all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How delightful it is to see approaching over the mountains
the feet of a messenger who announces peace,
a messenger who brings good news, who announces deliverance,
who says to Zion, “Your God reigns!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, your watchmen shout;
in unison they shout for joy,
for they see with their very own eyes
the Lord’s return to Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In unison give a joyful shout,
O ruins of Jerusalem!
For the Lord consoles his people;
he protects Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reveals his royal power
in the sight of all the nations;
the entire earth sees
our God deliver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave! Leave! Get out of there!
Don’t touch anything unclean!
Get out of it!
Stay pure, you who carry the Lord’s holy items.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet do not depart quickly
or leave in a panic.
For the Lord goes before you;
the God of Israel is your rear guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, my servant will succeed!
He will be elevated, lifted high, and greatly exalted—
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
so now he will startle many nations.
Kings will be shocked by his exaltation,
for they will witness something unannounced to them,
and they will understand something they had not heard about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who would have believed what we just heard?
When was the Lord’s power revealed through him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sprouted up like a twig before God,
like a root out of parched soil;
he had no stately form or majesty that might catch our attention,
no special appearance that we should want to follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But he lifted up our illnesses,
he carried our pain;
even though we thought he was being punished,
attacked by God, and afflicted for something he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He was treated harshly and afflicted,
but he did not even open his mouth.
Like a lamb led to the slaughtering block,
like a sheep silent before her shearers,
he did not even open his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was led away after an unjust trial—
but who even cared?
Indeed, he was cut off from the land of the living;
because of the rebellion of his own people he was wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They intended to bury him with criminals,
but he ended up in a rich man’s tomb,
because he had committed no violent deeds,
nor had he spoken deceitfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the Lord desired to crush him and make him ill,
once restitution is made,
he will see descendants and enjoy long life,
and the Lord’s purpose will be accomplished through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Having suffered, he will reflect on his work,
he will be satisfied when he understands what he has done.
“My servant will acquit many,
for he carried their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will assign him a portion with the multitudes,
he will divide the spoils of victory with the powerful,
because he willingly submitted to death
and was numbered with the rebels,
when he lifted up the sin of many
and intervened on behalf of the rebels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Shout for joy, O barren one who has not given birth!
Give a joyful shout and cry out, you who have not been in labor!
For the children of the desolate one are more numerous
than the children of the married woman,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make your tent larger,
stretch your tent curtains farther out!
Spare no effort,
lengthen your ropes,
and pound your stakes deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t be afraid, for you will not be put to shame.
Don’t be intimidated, for you will not be humiliated.
You will forget about the shame you experienced in your youth;
you will no longer remember the disgrace of your abandonment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your husband is the one who made you—
the Lord of Heaven’s Armies is his name.
He is your Protector, the Holy One of Israel.
He is called “God of the entire earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, the Lord will call you back
like a wife who has been abandoned and suffers from depression,
like a young wife when she has been rejected,” says your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For a short time I abandoned you,
but with great compassion I will gather you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a burst of anger I rejected you momentarily,
but with lasting devotion I will have compassion on you,”
says your Protector, the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As far as I am concerned, this is like in Noah’s time,
when I vowed that the waters of Noah’s flood would never again cover the earth.
In the same way I have vowed that I will not be angry at you or shout at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even if the mountains are removed
and the hills displaced,
my devotion will not be removed from you,
nor will my covenant of friendship be displaced,”
says the Lord, the one who has compassion on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O afflicted one, driven away, and unconsoled!
Look, I am about to set your stones in antimony,
and lay your foundation with lapis lazuli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make your pinnacles out of gems,
your gates out of beryl,
and your outer wall out of beautiful stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your children will be followers of the Lord,
and your children will enjoy great prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be reestablished when I vindicate you.
You will not experience oppression;
indeed, you will not be afraid.
You will not be terrified,
for nothing frightening will come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If anyone dares to challenge you, it will not be my doing!
Whoever tries to challenge you will be defeated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I create the craftsman,
who fans the coals into a fire
and forges a weapon.
I create the destroyer so he might devastate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No weapon forged to be used against you will succeed;
you will refute everyone who tries to accuse you.
This is what the Lord will do for his servants—
I will vindicate them,”
says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hey, all who are thirsty, come to the water!
You who have no money, come!
Buy and eat!
Come! Buy wine and milk
without money and without cost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why pay money for something that will not nourish you?
Why spend your hard-earned money on something that will not satisfy?
Listen carefully to me and eat what is nourishing!
Enjoy fine food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention and come to me.
Listen, so you can live.
Then I will make an unconditional covenantal promise to you,
just like the reliable covenantal promises I made to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I made him a witness to nations,
a ruler and commander of nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, you will summon nations you did not previously know;
nations that did not previously know you will run to you,
because of the Lord your God,
the Holy One of Israel,
for he bestows honor on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek the Lord while he makes himself available;
call to him while he is nearby!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked need to abandon their lifestyle
and sinful people their plans.
They should return to the Lord, and he will show mercy to them,
and to their God, for he will freely forgive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, my plans are not like your plans,
and my deeds are not like your deeds,” says the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“for just as the sky is higher than the earth,
so my deeds are superior to your deeds
and my plans superior to your plans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rain and snow fall from the sky
and do not return,
but instead water the earth
and make it produce and yield crops,
and provide seed for the planter and food for those who must eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the same way, the promise that I make
does not return to me, having accomplished nothing.
No, it is realized as I desire
and is fulfilled as I intend.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Evergreens will grow in place of thorn bushes,
firs will grow in place of nettles;
they will be a monument to the Lord,
a permanent reminder that will remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says,
“Promote justice! Do what is right!
For I am ready to deliver you;
I am ready to vindicate you openly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people who do this will be blessed,
the people who commit themselves to obedience,
who observe the Sabbath and do not defile it,
who refrain from doing anything that is wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No foreigner who becomes a follower of the Lord should say,
‘The Lord will certainly exclude me from his people.’
The eunuch should not say,
‘Look, I am like a dried-up tree.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says:
“For the eunuchs who observe my Sabbaths
and choose what pleases me
and are faithful to my covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set up within my temple and my walls a monument
that will be better than sons and daughters.
I will set up a permanent monument for them that will remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for foreigners who become followers of the Lord and serve him,
who love the name of the Lord and want to be his servants—
all who observe the Sabbath and do not defile it,
and who are faithful to my covenant—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring them to my holy mountain;
I will make them happy in the temple where people pray to me.
Their burnt offerings and sacrifices will be accepted on my altar,
for my temple will be known as a temple where all nations may pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Sovereign Lord says this,
the one who gathers the dispersed of Israel:
“I will still gather them up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All you wild animals in the fields, come and devour,
all you wild animals in the forest!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All their watchmen are blind,
they are unaware.
All of them are like mute dogs,
unable to bark.
They pant, lie down,
and love to snooze.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Each one says,
‘Come on, I’ll get some wine!
Let’s guzzle some beer!
Tomorrow will be just like today!
We’ll have everything we want!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The godly perish,
but no one cares.
Honest people disappear,
when no one minds
that the godly disappear because of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who live uprightly enter a place of peace;
they rest on their beds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But approach, you sons of omen readers,
you offspring of adulteresses and prostitutes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At whom are you laughing?
At whom are you opening your mouth
and sticking out your tongue?
You are the children of rebels,
the offspring of liars,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you who inflame your lusts among the oaks and under every green tree,
who slaughter children near the streams under the rocky overhangs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Among the smooth stones of the stream are the idols you love;
they, they are the object of your devotion.
You pour out liquid offerings to them,
you make an offering.
Because of these things how can I relent from judgment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On every high, elevated hill you prepare your bed;
you go up there to offer sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behind the door and doorpost you put your symbols.
Indeed, you depart from me and go up
and invite them into bed with you.
You purchase favors from them;
you love their bed,
and gaze longingly on their naked bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You take olive oil as tribute to your king,
along with many perfumes.
You send your messengers to a distant place;
you go all the way to Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the long distance you must travel, you get tired,
but you do not say, ‘I give up.’
You get renewed energy,
so you don’t collapse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom are you worried about?
Whom do you fear, that you would act so deceitfully
and not remember me
or think about me?
Because I have been silent for so long,
you are not afraid of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will denounce your so-called righteousness and your deeds,
but they will not help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you cry out for help, let your idols help you!
The wind blows them all away,
a breeze carries them away.
But the one who looks to me for help will inherit the land
and will have access to my holy mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He says,
“Build it! Build it! Clear a way!
Remove all the obstacles out of the way of my people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the high and exalted one says,
the one who rules forever, whose name is holy:
“I dwell in an exalted and holy place,
but also with the discouraged and humiliated,
in order to cheer up the humiliated
and to encourage the discouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will not be hostile forever
or perpetually angry,
for then man’s spirit would grow faint before me,
the life-giving breath I created.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen their behavior,
but I will heal them. I will lead them,
and I will provide comfort to them and those who mourn with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the one who gives them reason to celebrate.
Complete prosperity is available both to those who are far away and those who are nearby,”
says the Lord, “and I will heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: There will be no prosperity,” says my God, “for the wicked.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Shout loudly! Don’t be quiet!
Yell as loudly as a trumpet!
Confront my people with their rebellious deeds;
confront Jacob’s family with their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They lament, ‘Why don’t you notice when we fast?
Why don’t you pay attention when we humble ourselves?’
Look, at the same time you fast, you satisfy your selfish desires,
you oppress your workers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, your fasting is accompanied by arguments, brawls,
and fistfights.
Do not fast as you do today,
trying to make your voice heard in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this really the kind of fasting I want?
Do I want a day when people merely humble themselves,
bowing their heads like a reed
and stretching out on sackcloth and ashes?
Is this really what you call a fast,
a day that is pleasing to the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No, this is the kind of fast I want:
I want you to remove the sinful chains,
to tear away the ropes of the burdensome yoke,
to set free the oppressed,
and to break every burdensome yoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I want you to share your food with the hungry
and to provide shelter for homeless, oppressed people.
When you see someone naked, clothe them!
Don’t turn your back on your own flesh and blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will call out, and the Lord will respond;
you will cry out, and he will reply, ‘Here I am.’
You must remove the burdensome yoke from among you
and stop pointing fingers and speaking sinfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You must actively help the hungry
and feed the oppressed.
Then your light will dispel the darkness,
and your darkness will be transformed into noonday.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will continually lead you;
he will feed you even in parched regions.
He will give you renewed strength,
and you will be like a well-watered garden,
like a spring that continually produces water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your perpetual ruins will be rebuilt;
you will reestablish the ancient foundations.
You will be called, ‘The one who repairs broken walls,
the one who makes the streets inhabitable again.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You must observe the Sabbath
rather than doing anything you please on my holy day.
You must look forward to the Sabbath
and treat the Lord’s holy day with respect.
You must treat it with respect by refraining from your normal activities,
and by refraining from your selfish pursuits and from making business deals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will find joy in your relationship to the Lord,
and I will give you great prosperity,
and cause crops to grow on the land I gave to your ancestor Jacob.”
Know for certain that the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, the Lord’s hand is not too weak to deliver you;
his ear is not too deaf to hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But your sinful acts have alienated you from your God;
your sins have caused him to reject you and not listen to your prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your hands are stained with blood
and your fingers with sin;
your lips speak lies,
your tongue utters malicious words.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They hatch the eggs of a poisonous snake
and spin a spider’s web.
Whoever eats their eggs will die,
a poisonous snake is hatched.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are eager to do evil,
quick to shed innocent blood.
Their thoughts are sinful;
they crush and destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are unfamiliar with peace;
their deeds are unjust.
They use deceitful methods,
and whoever deals with them is unfamiliar with peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this reason deliverance is far from us
and salvation does not reach us.
We wait for light, but see only darkness;
we wait for a bright light, but live in deep darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We grope along the wall like the blind,
we grope like those who cannot see;
we stumble at noontime as if it were evening.
Though others are strong, we are like dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We all growl like bears,
we coo mournfully like doves;
we wait for deliverance, but there is none,
for salvation, but it is far from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Justice is driven back;
godliness stands far off.
Indeed, honesty stumbles in the city square
and morality is not even able to enter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honesty has disappeared;
the one who tries to avoid evil is robbed.
The Lord watches and is displeased,
for there is no justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He wears his desire for justice like body armor,
and his desire to deliver is like a helmet on his head.
He puts on the garments of vengeance
and wears zeal like a robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He repays them for what they have done,
dispensing angry judgment to his adversaries
and punishing his enemies.
He repays the coastlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the west, people respect the Lord’s reputation;
in the east they recognize his splendor.
For he comes like a rushing stream
driven on by wind sent from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A protector comes to Zion,
to those in Jacob who repent of their rebellious deeds,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for me, this is my promise to them,” says the Lord. “My Spirit, who is upon you, and my words, which I have placed in your mouth, will not depart from your mouth or from the mouths of your children and descendants from this time forward,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Arise! Shine! For your light arrives!
The splendor of the Lord shines on you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For, look, darkness covers the earth
and deep darkness covers the nations,
but the Lord shines on you;
his splendor appears over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nations come to your light,
kings to your bright light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look all around you!
They all gather and come to you—
your sons come from far away,
and your daughters are escorted by guardians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will look and smile,
you will be excited and your heart will swell with pride.
For the riches of distant lands will belong to you,
and the wealth of nations will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Camel caravans will cover your roads,
young camels from Midian and Ephah.
All the merchants of Sheba will come,
bringing gold and incense
and singing praises to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the sheep of Kedar will be gathered to you;
the rams of Nebaioth will be available to you as sacrifices.
They will go up on my altar acceptably,
and I will bestow honor on my majestic temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who are these who float along like a cloud,
who fly like doves to their shelters?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, the coastlands look eagerly for me;
the large ships are in the lead,
bringing your sons from far away,
along with their silver and gold,
to honor the Lord your God,
the Holy One of Israel, for he has bestowed honor on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foreigners will rebuild your walls;
their kings will serve you.
Even though I struck you down in my anger,
I will restore my favor and have compassion on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your gates will remain open at all times;
they will not be shut during the day or at night,
so that the wealth of nations may be delivered,
with their kings leading the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, nations or kingdoms that do not serve you will perish;
such nations will definitely be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The splendor of Lebanon will come to you,
its evergreens, firs, and cypresses together,
to beautify my palace;
I will bestow honor on my throne room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of your oppressors will come bowing to you;
all who treated you with disrespect will bow down at your feet.
They will call you, ‘The City of the Lord,
Zion of the Holy One of Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were once abandoned
and despised, with no one passing through,
but I will make you a permanent source of pride
and joy to coming generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will drink the milk of nations;
you will nurse at the breasts of kings.
Then you will recognize that I, the Lord, am your Deliverer,
your Protector, the Powerful One of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sounds of violence will no longer be heard in your land,
or the sounds of destruction and devastation within your borders.
You will name your walls, ‘Deliverance,’
and your gates, ‘Praise.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun will no longer supply light for you by day,
nor will the moon’s brightness shine on you;
the Lord will be your permanent source of light—
the splendor of your God will shine upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Spirit of the Sovereign Lord is upon me,
because the Lord has chosen me.
He has commissioned me to encourage the poor,
to help the brokenhearted,
to decree the release of captives,
and the freeing of prisoners,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to announce the year when the Lord will show his favor,
the day when our God will seek vengeance,
to console all who mourn,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to strengthen those who mourn in Zion,
by giving them a turban, instead of ashes,
oil symbolizing joy, instead of mourning,
a garment symbolizing praise, instead of discouragement.
They will be called oaks of righteousness,
trees planted by the Lord to reveal his splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will rebuild the perpetual ruins
and restore the places that were desolate;
they will reestablish the ruined cities,
the places that have been desolate since ancient times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Foreigners will take care of your sheep;
foreigners will work in your fields and vineyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be called, ‘the Lord’s priests,
servants of our God.’
You will enjoy the wealth of nations
and boast about the riches you receive from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Instead of shame, you will get a double portion;
instead of humiliation, they will rejoice over the land they receive.
Yes, they will possess a double portion in their land
and experience lasting joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I, the Lord, love justice
and hate robbery and sin.
I will repay them because of my faithfulness;
I will make a permanent covenant with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their descendants will be known among the nations,
their offspring among the peoples.
All who see them will recognize that
the Lord has blessed them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For just as the ground produces its crops
and a garden yields its produce,
so the Sovereign Lord will cause deliverance to grow,
and give his people reason to praise him in the sight of all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Nations will see your vindication,
and all kings your splendor.
You will be called by a new name
that the Lord himself will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be a majestic crown in the hand of the Lord,
a royal turban in the hand of your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will no longer be called, “Abandoned,”
and your land will no longer be called “Desolate.”
Indeed, you will be called “My Delight is in Her,”
and your land “Married.”
For the Lord will take delight in you,
and your land will be married to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a young man marries a young woman,
so your sons will marry you.
As a bridegroom rejoices over a bride,
so your God will rejoice over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t allow him to rest until he reestablishes Jerusalem,
until he makes Jerusalem the pride of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord swears an oath by his right hand,
by his strong arm:
“I will never again give your grain
to your enemies as food,
and foreigners will not drink your wine,
which you worked hard to produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who harvest the grain will eat it,
and will praise the Lord.
Those who pick the grapes will drink the wine
in the courts of my holy sanctuary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come through! Come through the gates!
Prepare the way for the people!
Build it—Build the roadway!
Remove the stones.
Lift a signal flag for the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, the Lord announces to the entire earth:
“Say to Daughter Zion,
‘Look, your deliverer comes!
Look, his reward is with him,
and his reward goes before him!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be called, “The Holy People,
the Ones Protected by the Lord.”
You will be called, “Sought After,
City Not Abandoned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is this who comes from Edom,
dressed in bright red, coming from Bozrah?
Who is this one wearing royal attire,
who marches confidently because of his great strength?
“It is I, the one who announces vindication,
and who is able to deliver!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are your clothes red?
Why do you look like someone who has stomped on grapes in a vat?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I looked forward to the day of vengeance,
and then payback time arrived.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will tell of the faithful acts of the Lord,
of the Lord’s praiseworthy deeds.
I will tell about all the Lord did for us,
the many good things he did for the family of Israel,
because of his compassion and great faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “Certainly they will be my people,
children who are not disloyal.”
He became their deliverer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through all that they suffered, he suffered too.
The messenger sent from his very presence delivered them.
In his love and mercy he protected them;
he lifted them up and carried them throughout ancient times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they rebelled and offended his holy Spirit,
so he turned into an enemy
and fought against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His people remembered the ancient times.
Where is the one who brought them up out of the sea,
along with the shepherd of his flock?
Where is the one who placed his holy Spirit among them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the one who made his majestic power available to Moses,
who divided the water before them,
gaining for himself a lasting reputation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who led them through the deep water?
Like a horse running through the wilderness they did not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As an animal that goes down into a valley to graze,
so the Spirit of the Lord granted them rest.
In this way you guided your people,
gaining for yourself an honored reputation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look down from heaven and take notice,
from your holy, majestic palace!
Where are your zeal and power?
Do not hold back your tender compassion!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you are our father,
though Abraham does not know us
and Israel does not recognize us.
You, Lord, are our father;
you have been called our Protector from ancient times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, Lord, do you make us stray from your ways,
and make our minds stubborn so that we do not obey you?
Return for the sake of your servants,
the tribes of your inheritance!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a short time your special nation possessed a land,
but then our adversaries knocked down your holy sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
(63:19b) If only you would tear apart the sky and come down!
The mountains would tremble before you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(64:1) As when fire ignites dry wood,
or fire makes water boil,
let your adversaries know who you are,
and may the nations shake at your presence!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you performed awesome deeds that took us by surprise,
you came down, and the mountains trembled before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since ancient times no one has heard or perceived,
no eye has seen any God besides you,
who intervenes for those who wait for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You assist those who delight in doing what is right,
who observe your commandments.
Look, you were angry because we violated them continually.
How then can we be saved?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are all like one who is unclean,
all our so-called righteous acts are like a menstrual rag in your sight.
We all wither like a leaf;
our sins carry us away like the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one invokes your name,
or makes an effort to take hold of you.
For you have rejected us
and handed us over to our own sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, do not be too angry!
Do not hold our sins against us continually.
Take a good look at your people, at all of us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Our holy temple, our pride and joy,
the place where our ancestors praised you,
has been burned with fire;
all our prized possessions have been destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In light of all this, how can you still hold back, Lord?
How can you be silent and continue to humiliate us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I made myself available to those who did not ask for me;
I appeared to those who did not look for me.
I said, ‘Here I am! Here I am!’
to a nation that did not invoke my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I spread out my hands all day long
to my rebellious people,
who lived in a way that is morally unacceptable,
and who did what they desired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These people continually and blatantly offend me
as they sacrifice in their sacred orchards
and burn incense on brick altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sit among the tombs
and keep watch all night long.
They eat pork,
and broth from unclean sacrificial meat is in their pans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, ‘Keep to yourself!
Don’t get near me, for I am holier than you!’
These people are like smoke in my nostrils,
like a fire that keeps burning all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for your sins and your ancestors’ sins,” says the Lord.
“Because they burned incense on the mountains
and offended me on the hills,
I will punish them in full measure.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“When juice is discovered in a cluster of grapes,
someone says, ‘Don’t destroy it, for it contains juice.’
So I will do for the sake of my servants—
I will not destroy everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring forth descendants from Jacob,
and from Judah people to take possession of my mountains.
My chosen ones will take possession of the land;
my servants will live there.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But as for you who abandon the Lord
and forget about worshiping at my holy mountain,
who prepare a feast for the god called ‘Fortune,’
and fill up wine jugs for the god called ‘Destiny’—
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So this is what the Sovereign Lord says:
“Look, my servants will eat, but you will be hungry.
Look, my servants will drink, but you will be thirsty.
Look, my servants will rejoice, but you will be humiliated.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your names will live on in the curse formulas of my chosen ones.
The Sovereign Lord will kill you,
but he will give his servants another name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For look, I am ready to create
new heavens and a new earth!
The former ones will not be remembered;
no one will think about them anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But be happy and rejoice forevermore
over what I am about to create!
For look, I am ready to create Jerusalem to be a source of joy,
and her people to be a source of happiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem will bring me joy,
and my people will bring me happiness.
The sound of weeping or cries of sorrow
will never be heard in her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Never again will one of her infants live just a few days
or an old man die before his time.
Indeed, no one will die before the age of one hundred;
anyone who fails to reach the age of one hundred will be considered cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will build houses and live in them;
they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No longer will they build a house only to have another live in it,
or plant a vineyard only to have another eat its fruit,
for my people will live as long as trees,
and my chosen ones will enjoy to the fullest what they have produced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will not work in vain,
or give birth to children that will experience disaster.
For the Lord will bless their children
and their descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before they even call out, I will respond;
while they are still speaking, I will hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wolf and a lamb will graze together;
a lion, like an ox, will eat straw,
and a snake’s food will be dirt.
They will no longer injure or destroy
on my entire royal mountain,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“The heavens are my throne
and the earth is my footstool.
Where then is the house you will build for me?
Where is the place where I will rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My hand made them;
that is how they came to be,” says the Lord.
“I show special favor to the humble and contrite,
who respect what I have to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to the Lord’s message,
you who respect his word!
“Your countrymen, who hate you
and exclude you, supposedly for the sake of my name,
say, ‘May the Lord be glorified,
then we will witness your joy.’
But they will be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Before she goes into labor, she gives birth!
Before her contractions begin, she delivers a boy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has ever heard of such a thing?
Who has ever seen this?
Can a country be brought forth in one day?
Can a nation be born in a single moment?
Yet as soon as Zion goes into labor she gives birth to sons!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do I bring a baby to the birth opening and then not deliver it?”
asks the Lord.
“Or do I bring a baby to the point of delivery and then hold it back?”
asks your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Be happy for Jerusalem
and rejoice with her, all you who love her!
Share in her great joy,
all you who have mourned over her!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you will nurse from her satisfying breasts and be nourished;
you will feed with joy from her milk-filled breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says:
“Look, I am ready to extend to her prosperity that will flow like a river,
the riches of nations will flow into her like a stream that floods its banks.
You will nurse from her breast and be carried at her side;
you will play on her knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a mother consoles a child,
so I will console you,
and you will be consoled over Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you see this, you will be happy,
and you will be revived.
The Lord will reveal his power to his servants
and his anger to his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For look, the Lord comes with fire,
his chariots come like a windstorm,
to reveal his raging anger,
his battle cry, and his flaming arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “As for those who consecrate and ritually purify themselves so they can follow their leader and worship in the sacred orchards, those who eat the flesh of pigs and other disgusting creatures, like mice—they will all be destroyed together,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I hate their deeds and thoughts! So I am coming to gather all the nations and ethnic groups; they will come and witness my splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will perform a mighty act among them and then send some of those who remain to the nations—to Tarshish, Pul, Lud (known for its archers), Tubal, Javan, and to the distant coastlands that have not heard about me or seen my splendor. They will tell the nations of my splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will bring back all your countrymen from all the nations as an offering to the Lord. They will bring them on horses, in chariots, in wagons, on mules, and on camels to my holy hill Jerusalem,” says the Lord, “just as the Israelites bring offerings to the Lord’s temple in ritually pure containers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will choose some of them as priests and Levites,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For just as the new heavens and the new earth I am about to make will remain standing before me,” says the Lord, “so your descendants and your name will remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From one month to the next and from one Sabbath to the next, all people will come to worship me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They will go out and observe the corpses of those who rebelled against me, for the maggots that eat them will not die, and the fire that consumes them will not die out. All people will find the sight abhorrent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
